alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 06 at 5:35AM AKST until February 07 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, the Ward Lake Recreation area in the southern inner channels. * WHEN...Until 100 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 AM AKST, moderate to heavy rain was reported overnight with showers expected through the day. - Areas near the Ward Lake recreational area is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Lake Connell Dam: At 12:00pm the stage was 251.5 feet. Flood Stage is 252.0 feet. Impacts: At 251.0 feet: Water will begin to approach low lying areas of trails and picnic areas around Ward Lake. At 252.0 feet: 2 feet of water will be going over the emergency spillway which will produce minor flooding of areas around the Ward Lake recreation area with trails and Last Chance campground being inundated.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
